body:
<!-- **Are you in the right place?**
1. For issues or feature requests, please create an issue in this repository.
2. For general technical and non-technical questions, we are happy to help you on our [Rook.io Slack](https://Rook-io.slack.com).
3. Did you already search the existing open issues for anything similar? -->

**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**
arm64 images download, then contain x86_64 binaries

**Expected behavior:**
arm64 binaries

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
<!-- Please let us know any circumstances for reproduction of your bug. -->
Pull on an arm64 device, image will refuse to run. Extracting a binary and running through `file` shows it to be x86_64.
I checked the binary format with the following commands:
```shell
$ docker run --rm -it -v $PWD/tmp:/app busybox cp /bin/busybox /app/
$ docker run --rm -it -v $PWD/tmp:/app --entrypoint /app/busybox rook/ceph:master cp /bin/sh /app/
$ file tmp/sh
tmp/sh: ELF 64-bit LSB executable, x86-64, version 1 (SYSV), dynamically linked, interpreter /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2, for GNU/Linux 2.6.32, BuildID[sha1]=765c505bb8a234fcd64ede405fa7fcb25734f06a, stripped
```

 https://i.imgur.com/xEC3Ryx.png

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): HypriotOS 64bit build (Debian 9 Stretch)
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): Linux pi-cluster-2 4.14.37-hypriotos-v8 #1 SMP PREEMPT Sun Apr 29 17:26:16 UTC 2018 aarch64 GNU/Linux
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: Raspberry Pi 3B+
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): master
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): 1.10.5
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): RKE
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/Rook/master/toolbox.html)): N/A

milestone.description:
* Multiple storage backends
  * Full design
  * Refactor code base and repositories to enable
  * Consider support for Minio, potentially early support for other backends time permitting
* Switch CRDs to API Aggregation
* Run on arbitrary PVs
* Remove Rook API and CLI
* Migrate CI and release pipelines to a solution hosted by the CNCF
* Run with Least Privileged and possibly without privileged containers
* Shutdown / restart issues
* Support Kubernetes 1.7+ only
* Ceph features and improvements
  * Adding/removing disks (lifecycle issues, failures, 1 OSD per pod, etc.)
  * Placement group balancer support (ceph-mgr module)
  * Mon reliability (restarts, failing over too fast, ip changes, etc.)
  * Mimic support

title: arm64 images are using 64bit images and binaries
